NetworkDialog.Title: ADB Network Connection
NetworkDialog.FormTitle: Connect an Android device via network
NetworkDialog.InstructionsText:
To connect an Android device via network:

1. On your Android device:
   ‚Ä¢ Enable USB debugging in developer options
   ‚Ä¢ Connect the device to the same WiFi network as your PC

2. Find your device's IP address:
   ‚Ä¢ Go to Settings ‚Üí About ‚Üí Status ‚Üí IP Address
   ‚Ä¢ Or use an app like "Network Info II"

3. Enable ADB via TCP/IP (if not already done):
   ‚Ä¢ Connect the device via USB first
   ‚Ä¢ Use the command: adb tcpip 5555

4. Enter the IP address and port (usually 5555)

5. Click "Connect"
NetworkDialog.ConnectionErrorMessage:
Unable to connect to the device.

Error: {0}

Make sure that:
‚Ä¢ The device is on the same network
‚Ä¢ USB/network debugging is enabled
‚Ä¢ The ADB port is open (usually 5555)
NetworkDialog.InvalidIpAddress: The IP address is not valid.
NetworkDialog.InvalidPort: The port must be a number between 1 and 65535.
